elements.title: Book of Roads and Kingdoms (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Book of Roads and Kingdoms includes illustrations so geometric that they are barely recognizable as maps (example pictured)?

elements.title: Carol Thomas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Carol Thomas began her football career at the age of 11, while the sport was still banned for women?

elements.title: Ashford International Studios (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the old Ashford railway works is being redeveloped into Ashford International Studios?

elements.title: Brison Manor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brison Manor, who played eight years in the National Football League, had never set foot outside of his home state before attending college?

elements.title: his final two concerts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that indie rock band Built to Spill accompanied outsider musician Daniel Johnston at his final two concerts?

elements.title: Karl Rozental (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Karl Rozental was investigated and surveilled by police after the 1912 sappers' revolt in Tashkent?

elements.title: Moderator Mayhem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the web-based video game Moderator Mayhem was based on a card game meant to demonstrate the difficulties of content moderation?

elements.title: Goddard. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Goddard. learned Reason?
